qas.question: In what century did the history of the steam engine begin?
What was Hero of Alexandria's nationality?
Who described a steam turbine in 1629?
In what year did Jerónimo de Ayanz y Beaumont patent a water pump for draining mines?
In what century did the history of the steam digester begin?
What was Hero of Ayanz's nationality?
Who described a steam turbine in 1690?
In what year did Jeronimo de Ayanz y Beaumont patent a water pump for draining patients?

context: The history of the steam engine stretches back as far as the <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><b5_0>first<b5_0/><a0_0/> century AD<a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/>; the first recorded rudimentary steam engine being the aeolipile described by <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><b7_0>Greek<b7_0/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> mathematician <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><b6_0>Hero of Alexandria<b6_0/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. In the following centuries, the few steam-powered "engines" known were, like the aeolipile, essentially experimental devices used by inventors to demonstrate the properties of steam. A rudimentary steam turbine device was described by Taqi al-Din in 1551 and by <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><b8_0>Giovanni Branca<b8_0/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> in 1629. Jerónimo de Ayanz y Beaumont received patents in <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><b9_0>1606<b9_0/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> for fifty steam powered inventions, including a water pump for draining inundated mines. Denis Papin, a Huguenot refugee, did some useful work on the steam digester in 1679, and first used a piston to raise weights in 1690.
